context: The word 'armastan' is the first person singular present tense form of the Estonian verb 'armastama', which means 'to love'. It specifically translates to 'I love' in English. In Estonian, this verb follows regular conjugation patterns where the ending changes based on the subject and tense: 'armastan' (I love), 'armastad' (you love), 'armastab' (he/she/it loves), etc.
